concise_definition: n. 职责, 义务, 关税

definitions.explanation_en: Moral or legal obligations that a person is expected to fulfill, especially as part of their role or position in society, work, or family.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个人因其在社会、工作或家庭中的角色而被期望履行的道德或法律义务。
definitions.example_en: It is the duty of every citizen to pay taxes and obey the law.
definitions.example_cn: 每个公民都有缴税和守法的义务。

definitions.explanation_en: Specific tasks or responsibilities assigned to someone as part of their job or routine.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指作为某人工作或日常事务的一部分所分配的具体任务或职责。
definitions.example_en: Her daily duties include answering phones, filing documents, and scheduling meetings.
definitions.example_cn: 她的日常职责包括接电话、归档文件和安排会议。

definitions.explanation_en: A tax imposed by a government on imported or exported goods.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指政府对进口或出口商品征收的税款。
definitions.example_en: The import duties on electronics have increased significantly this year.
definitions.example_cn: 今年电子产品进口关税大幅上涨。

comparison.analysis: “Responsibilities”（责任）范围更广，强调对结果或行为的承担，常包含道德、情感或长期承诺的成分；而 “duties” 更侧重于具体、制度化或法定的义务，通常与角色或职位直接挂钩，更具执行性。
“Obligations”（义务）更强调法律、契约或道德上的约束力，常带有强制性；“duties” 则更常用于日常语境，指因身份或职位而自然产生的任务，语气相对中性，不一定涉及法律后果。
“Tasks”（任务）泛指任何需要完成的具体工作，不必然带有道德或制度性约束；而 “duties” 暗示这些任务是必须履行的，通常与角色、身份或规范相关，具有更强的规范性和必要性。
